content:
Yes, there were many famous composers in both the medieval and Renaissance periods. 

In the medieval period, some notable composers include Hildegard von Bingen, who composed Gregorian chants and other religious music, and Guillaume de Machaut, who wrote both sacred and secular music. 

In the Renaissance, some famous composers include Josquin des Prez, who was known for his motets and masses, Giovanni Pierluigi da Palestrina, who composed over 100 masses and was a major contributor to the development of polyphonic music, and William Byrd, who was known for his compositions for the Anglican Church during the English Reformation. 

There are many other renowned composers from these periods as well, and their music remains popular and influential today.
